summary: This bill, the Social Security Check Tax Cut Act, proposes a temporary reduction in the amount of Social Security and Tier 1 railroad retirement benefits included in gross income for tax purposes. This reduction applies to taxable years 2026 and 2027, with a 10% reduction in 2026 and a 20% reduction in 2027.  Funds equivalent to the reduced tax revenue will be appropriated from the general fund to maintain the solvency of the Social Security and Medicare trust funds.  The bill primarily impacts those receiving retirement, disability, and survivors benefits.
